decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the original consent (Ref 205321FUL dated 27/04/2021) was granted.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 20-042-E01 (Existing OS Plan), 20-042-E02 (Existing Ground Floor Plan), 20-042-E03 (Existing First Floor Plan), 20-042-E04 (Existing Roof Plan), 20-042-E05 (Existing Front Elevation North Facing), 20-042-E06 (Existing Rear Elevation South Facing A-A), 20-042-E07 (Existing Rear Elevation South Facing B-B), 20-042-E08 (Existing Section A-A), 20-042-P01 (Proposed OS Plan), 20-042-P02 Rev A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan), 20-042-P03 Rev A (Proposed First Floor Plan), 20-042-P04 (Proposed Second Floor Plan), 20-042-P05 Rev A (Proposed Third Floor Plan), Design + Access Statement prepared by Red + White dated December 2020; 7418/MMA/10 Proposed Roof Plan; 7418/MMA/11B Proposed Front Elevation (North); 7418/MMA/12B Proposed Rear Elevation (South); 7418/MMA/13A Proposed Section AA; Minor Material Amendment Statement October 2023 (Rev A)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host property and local area, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| Other than the balcony/roof terrace identified in the approved plans listed under condition 2, no part of the roof of the building shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

| The cycle and refuse storage areas identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle and refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with Ealing SPG 4 and policies SI 8 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development (except demolition and ground works), a noise assessment (according to standards of the Council's SPG10) shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial/ cultural sources including aircraft noise (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB)) (incl. reflected and re-radiated noise where appropriate). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) and mitigation measures to achieve internal room standards of SPG10 and noise limits specified by BS8233:2014. Details of best practicable mitigation measures to achieve these criteria also in external amenity shall be submitted. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Ealing SPG10, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

| Prior to commencement of the development (except demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of type and level of noise from the commercial parts of the development, affecting residents and the sound insulation value of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the commercial premises from dwellings. Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value is enhanced by at least 10/15/20dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use and that, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of residential occupiers within the building or adjacent in accordance with Ealing SPG 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The details of the demolition method statement and construction management plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning application ref: 230983CND dated 30 May 2023.
The approved details shall be implemented throughout the construction of the hereby approved development.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD, policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

| Prior to the commencement of the development (exception for demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation in the dwellings of a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air. The details to be submitted shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system.  The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To protect the amenity of future occupiers in accordance with policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to  allow changes on the height of the building and some minor alterations to the front and rear of the building, in pursuant to planning permission reference 205321FUL dated 02/09/2022 for ''Construction of four-storey building to provide 1no. commercial unit at ground floor level and 6no. self-contained residential units; and provision of associated amenity space, refuse and cycle storage (following demolition of existing building)''
